data.title: ​​10 Must visit historical monuments in Kolkata ​
data.meta_description: Kolkata is home to a rich heritage of historical monuments that showcase the city's colonial past, artistic traditions, and architectural marvels. Here are 10 must-visit historical monuments in Kolkata:
data.text:
Victoria Memorial

Built in memory of Queen Victoria, this magnificent white marble building is a masterpiece of British colonial architecture. The museum inside displays an impressive collection of art and artifacts from the British era.

Howrah Bridge

The Howrah Bridge is one of Kolkata's iconic landmarks, which is a steel suspension bridge that spans the Hooghly River. It is the busiest cantilever bridge in the world and an engineering marvel of its time.

St. Paul's Cathedral

This Gothic-style Anglican cathedral is a major attraction for tourists and religious devotees alike. The stunning stained glass windows, the intricate wooden carvings, and the serene ambiance make it a must-visit place.

Fort William

Built in 1696 by the British East India Company, Fort William is a large colonial fort that served as a military stronghold during British rule. Today, it is home to the Indian Army's Eastern Command headquarters.

Marble Palace

A stunning example of neoclassical architecture, the Marble Palace is a mansion built in 1835 by Raja Rajendra Mullick. The palace houses an impressive collection of paintings, sculptures, and antiques.

Shaheed Minar

Also known as the Ochterlony Monument, this 48-meter tall tower was built in 1828 to commemorate Sir David Ochterlony's victory in the Nepal War. The tower offers a panoramic view of Kolkata.

Belur Math

A pilgrimage center for the Ramakrishna Mission, the Belur Math is a complex of buildings that house a temple, a museum, and a library. The serene ambiance and the architectural beauty of the place attract tourists from all over the world.

Indian Museum

Established in 1814, the Indian Museum is the oldest and largest museum in India. It houses a vast collection of art, artifacts, and scientific specimens from all over the country.

Kalighat Temple

It is one of Kolkata's oldest and most revered temples, which is dedicated to the Hindu goddess Kali. The temple's architecture, rituals, and legends are a testament to the city's religious and cultural heritage.

Dakshineswar Kali Temple

Located on the banks of the Hooghly River, the Dakshineswar Kali Temple is a popular pilgrimage center for devotees of the Hindu goddess Kali. The temple's unique architecture and serene ambiance make it a must-visit place in Kolkata.
